title: Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Black Mission Fig Balsamic

ingredients.name: crumbled goat cheese or feta (optional topping)

directions: Rinse, trim, and halve Brussels sprouts.
Toss in a large bowl with olive oil, salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Optionally add maple syrup for extra caramelization.
Spread onto a baking sheet, cut side down for best caramelization.
Roast for 20-25 minutes, shaking the pan halfway through, until golden brown and crispy.
Drizzle with 1.5 tbsp of Black Mission Fig Balsamic Vinegar while hot. Toss to coat.
Serve warm. Top with goat cheese or feta if desired.
notes: The figgy depth of Black Mission Fig Balsamic Vinegar pairs really well with the crispy edges and slightly bitter sprouts. The recipe was built around that specific vinegar. Maple syrup is optional but adds a sweet and sticky quality.
